answers.answer: Hey, I'm not a doctor, but there are a few things that you can do. You need to monitor your blood pressure levels very often, as well as have your  blood checked for protein level. Limit your salt intake and watch out for foods high in sodium. Drink extra water to try to flush out toxins accumulating in your blood. Try to rest a lot and when you lie down, lie on your left hand side. There is no way to cure your condition until the baby is born. Try to be in contact and dialogue with your doctor very often. I hope things work out for you. Take care.

Well I'm kind of feeling abandoned by my OB.  I have a little bit of medical knowledge so that has helped.  I appreciate it!  I'll draw my blood tomorrow and get it tested for protein along with my kidney function.  I'm just extremely frustrated that I have all these signs and he isn't acknowledging them, just throwing meds at me.  Thank you!

question: Ok ladies.  4th pregnancy and 1st one to make it this far.  I'm 28 weeks.  Had a headache since Friday that is keeping me from eating or functioning. Lost 3 pounds since Tuesday.  Seen the OB and he gave me meds Tuesday.  I work in a Gyno office with a retired OB.  He checked my blood pressure today and it was 130/90.  Had protein, blood, white cells, glucose, and nitrates in my urine.  Legs are swollen and have been for a few weeks.  Called my OB and let them know what was going on.  They said they'd let me know.  Well OB is closed now and no phone call.  How would you guys handle this?  I recently loss Medicaid since I couldn't find my birth certificate so ER is a last ditch effort.  Just need some advice from any mommas that have preeclampsia.
title: preeclampsia?
